sub_title: Patent Examiner at European Patent Office
summary:
Professional Profile: I am a committed team player, with strong communication and interpersonal skills and an outgoing personality. I have a high degree of flexibility, a sense for deadlines and I find myself at ease with multitasking. I am keen on learning and I learn quickly. I have an active problem solving approach, combined with a sense for numbers and strong analytical skills.

Personal Profile: I am sociable, rational and persuasive. I have a curious approach, an international mindset and a critical eye.

I am looking for a job in a multinational company which is dealing with state-of-the-art technology, products or services and which could give me the opportunity to develop quickly and continuously my technical and business-related knowledge with a hands-on approach and which could give me the chance of covering also more managerial/leadership positions later on.

school.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

projects.title: Train the Trainer Camp Ekaterinburg, Russian Federation
projects.description:
The 2 week Train the Trainer event in Ekaterinburg, Russian Federation, was organized to prepare 16 new trainers for active international work in BEST - Board of European Students of Technology.

During 150h of immersive training and coaching, our participants got trained on public speaking, body language, facilitation, adult learning, personnality types, briefing and debriefing, visualization, etc.

contributors.headline: Patent Examiner at European Patent Office
Head of Data Engineering and Infrastructure at Stellantis

publications.name: Secondary electron emission yield (SEY) in amorphous and graphitic carbon films prepared by PLD

authors.headline: Patent Examiner at European Patent Office

authors.name: M. Alberti1 R. Ayouchi1 S. R. Bhattacharyya1* N. Bundaleski2 A. Moutinho2 O. Teodoro2 L. Aguilera3 M.

profile_positions.description:
I have started in the field of electrical connectors and I am now in the field of electrical cables. 
I am in charge of the search and examination of patent applications, which involve among other things the technical evaluation, the research of and comparison with the prior art and several iterations with the Applicants' representatives. I deal with patent applications from the moment they are filed until they are granted, refused on withdrawn.
I am currently also the gerant (classification manager) and the stock manager of my technical field and I have dealt with more than 350 patent applications so far.
profile_positions.title: Patent Examiner

profile_positions.description:
Working within the innovation group for the development of new measurement techniques, products and patent applications.

My job is mainly, but not only, focused on telecom optical cables and fiber optics and is based in the central R&D Headquarters of the Prysmian Group.
profile_positions.title: Innovation Engineer

profile_positions.description:
During my first year at Prysmian Group, I've been integrated within the Network Components Business Unit, with a job rotation in R&D, Operations and Sales.
In the R&D department, I followed the development of new products and the testing to be carried on for official qualifications of joints and terminations for high and medium voltage. I had the opportunity of learning about and taking part into the different stages of development of an R&D project and to see how failure analysis is dealt with.
During this period, I was also trained to have a full overview on how the company is organised and on the business peculiarities.

After that, I spent several months in one of the company's plants (Livorno Mare Plant), first learning about the internal dynamics and roles of the plant and then being responsible of the industrialization of a new product (which I had already been following during my R&D period). During this phase, the most important thing was being able to quickly react to solve the problems which might happen with the process or with the machinery.
I have also worked as a blue collar for one month, which gave me the chance to learn about the way a plant works from a different point of view and to propose some improvement ideas thanks to my direct experience. It also helped me to understand how important the relationship white-blue collars is. 

During the third part of the graduate programme, I got assigned to the sales department, where I learnt about the market distribution of the accessories business and cooperated with the sales manager in several projects and meetings. 
Moreover, I took care of the preparation of the documentation for qualification tests with foreign utilities, thus contacting all of the involved departments and coordinating the data collection.
profile_positions.title: Post Graduate Programme

profile_positions.description:
I am integrated in the R&D department, where I work on the definition, planning and execution of several projects, in cooperation with production and other departments.I am also in touch with suppliers,external bodies and central R&D headquarters which are involved in these activities in different ways.
These projects can span over several aspects of the factory activity, such as the introduction of new materials and new machines, DTC actions, preliminary tests, qualification and industrialisation of new products, feasibility studies.

As an R&D engineer, it is part of my tasks to define the test conditions, to make sure they meet the international standards and customer specifications, to plan and follow the tests while they are carried on and to draw conclusions and write reports after its conclusion.

ACHIEVEMENTS:
-Over 10 projects completed
-Over 900k€ savings for 2015/16
-Qualification of a new product class
profile_positions.title: R&D Engineer - Materials Development Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Working on the production lines for HV and MV electrical cables, I was one of the responsible people for the improvement of the efficiency and of the overall process. In order to do this, I have been deeply involved in Six Sigma projects under the supervision of a Six Sigma Black Belt.

One of the key production lines, through which the whole MV production needs to pass, fell directly under my responsibility from the process point of view: I took care of the process definition and improvement, investigated faults and non conformities to find out the root causes and solve any possible issue, prepared operative instructions and handbooks, designed new production toolings and made the necessary arrangements for tests to take place.

I have also worked on the installation of a new machine inside the plant, including the factory acceptance and site acceptance tests, the definition of the procedure and the formation of the operators. This task also involved visits to other plants of the group which are already using this kind of machine and constant contact with the suppliers.

I have been involved as a member of a dedicated task force dealing with a major change management program aimed at restructuring the whole data collection and data analysis system in order to improve production results and to eliminate time loss causes.

ACHIEVEMENTS:
-Non conformities reduction from 10% to 3%
-Over 200 solved non conformities 
-Successful audit for new product line (5M€/year sales for this product)
-Over 10 technical improvements implemented
profile_positions.title: Process Engineer

profile_positions.company: Board of European Students of Technology
profile_positions.description:
Trainers in the organization take care of the internal education of the active members (mosty on soft skills), operating in an international context by delivering trainings in different countries with international audience. 
I delivered more than 300 hours on several topics, including training twice the new generations of trainers in a 2 weeks long event.

In general, I am giving support for local groups in planning, organization, project management, HR management, team dynamics, teambuilding, fund-raising and several other topics

I have also done mentoring (6 mentees in total) and coaching (10 coachees in total) for personal development of the trainees in the framework of the organization, after getting trained myself on coaching techniques.

One of my favourite topic is the one revolving around Personality Types and how this knowledge can be beneficial on the workplace.
profile_positions.title: Soft skills trainer

profile_positions.company: Board of European Students of Technology
profile_positions.description:
After applying for the position and answering to the questions which were asked to me and the other candidates, I was elected by the full members of the committee to lead it for a whole year.

The committee deals with the events (and their quality and recognition) the local associates organise every year. It is composed by a variable number (60 to 100 in average) of members from the local groups, thus involving people from all over Europe.
Most of the communication and of the work happens online, and the coordinator is responsible of following things through with the project leaders and represent the committees on events.
Twice a year, some of the committee members also meet for a live working events, where the coordinator is responsible for everything regarding the content, the outcomes, their dissemination and the implementation of the decisions which might have been taken.

During my mandate, thanks to specific training and to the constant work in such a multicultural environment, I managed to develop my soft skills, such as Leadership, Project and Time-Management, Problem-solving, Persuasion and Negotiation, Online working, Teamwork
profile_positions.title: External Events Committee Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
I was part of the Balkans, East Mediterranean and Middle East sales team, working in close contact with three experienced salesmen. 

My task , upon receipt of an enquiry from a customer, was to research the best technical solution, contact the engineering department and the external suppliers in order to be sure to meet the customer's specifications, formulate a technical proposal and, together with a salesman, a commercial proposal which would then be submitted.

During the few months I managed to learn a lot about the products and the softwares which could help us in our job, so that in the end I could prepare a complete proposal by myself, just with the supervision of an experienced colleague.

ACHIEVEMENTS:
-Over 25 offers prepared (up to 8M€)
profile_positions.title: Application Engineer

profile_positions.description:
I have done my thesis integrated in one of the working groups inside the university.
I carried on a research project in cooperation with Universidade Nova in Lisbon and CERN, the outcomes of which have been included in a scientific paper afterwards.

During this period I had the opportunity to apply the theoretical knowledge I had, to produce several samples and analyse them with some of the most advanced techniques (AFM, SEM, TEM) in order to characterize them.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

volunteer_experiences.role: Full member, Soft skills Trainer, Committee Coordinator

company.name: Board of European Students of Technology
